oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Enfield pattern bayonet with remnants of leather scabbard
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This Enfield pattern bayonet with remnant of leather scabbard was used by Corporal Lorenzo Dow Atwood, 43rd Wis. Infantry Regiment, USA. Atwood used this British made bayonet with his American made 1863 Springfield rifle-musket (newp001), which was rarely done. The 43rd Wis. Infantry Regiment was part of the permanent garrison of the Federal supply depot at Johnsonville, Tenn. Pvt. Atwood fought in the battle at Johnsonville when Confederate cavalry attacked the depot from across the Tenn. River on Nov. 4, 1864.
